intro: Erythroxylum latifolium var. angustatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf copal tree, is a species native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree that typically grows in humid, lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its lanceolate,革质 (leathery) leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. Its fruit is a capsule containing numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. This plant is also valued for its role in traditional medicine and as a source of natural resins.
